If there are sentient beings, whether without feet, with two feet, with four feet, or with many feet, with form or formless, with perception or without perception, with neither perception nor non-perception, among all of them, the Tathagata is the foremost. The noble precepts are also explained in the same way.
Thus have I heard:
Once, the Buddha was staying at the Kalanda Bamboo Grove in Rajagriha.
At that time, the World-Honored One told the bhikshus:
Whatever is created by sentient beings in the world, all of it is based on the earth and established upon it;
In this way, all dharmas, conditioned and unconditioned, the dharma of detachment from desire is the foremost... and so on at length, up to the noble precepts are also explained in this way.
After the Buddha taught this sutra, the monks heard what the Buddha said, and joyfully undertook to follow it.
